Kernel/sources/fs/rfs.h

Go to the documentation of this file.
00001 #ifndef _RFS_DEFINITION_H_
00002 #define _RFS_DEFINITION_H_
00003 #include <fs/vfs.h>
00004 
00005 /* RFS is the name I gave to the internal temporary filesystem used by the OS which other filesystems are bound to
00006    the name stood for root FS, though its not just for the root file system any more, there seems to be no real reason to change the name
00007    RFS is only a simple VFS implementation that allows the creation of temporary directory structures by the OS for organizational purposes
00008    (And the binding of all file systems together), do not overestimate its capabilities...
00009  */
00010 
00011 struct rfs_structure 
00012 {
00013         fs_node_t** directory_entrys; //The fs nodes in this directory
00014         uint32 num_directory_entrys; //A int used to store the size of the array
00015 };
00016 
00017 typedef struct rfs_structure rfs_t;
00018 
00019 #endif //_RFS_DEFINITION_H_
